sub_title: Public Speaker | CISO | Cyber Security governance & strategy
summary:
Don Eijndhoven is a highly experienced Chief Information Security Officer. He has a long and distinguished professional record in the Cyber Security field advising globally operating enterprises as a thought leader, interim-CISO, cyber security strategist and enterprise architect. 

Don holds a Master’s degree in Crisis & Security Management (focused on Cyber Security Governance) from the University of Leiden and a Bachelor in Computer Science from the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences. He also holds multiple certifications from the prestigious Nyenrode Business University, where he is also a guest lecturer, teaching cyber security strategy and management within the Cyber Resilience curriculum. Professionally he is a holder of several well-known certifications such as CISSP, CEH, CCSP, CISM etc.

His articles on the state of affairs in the cyber security sector, covering topics such as digital geopolitics, cyber warfare, privacy and cybercrime, are regularly published both nationally and internationally. He also frequently speaks on public and private conferences as a Subject Matter Expert. Typical examples are Hacker Halted Miami, NATO’s CCDCOE Cyber Conflict Conference in Tallinn (Estonia) and HeliView’s Cyber Security conference in the Netherlands.
 
In 2011, Don founded the Dutch Cyber Warfare Community, a non-profit networking organisation which is dedicated to providing a platform for the Dutch Cyber Warfare industry. It currently consists of over 2500 members from the Dutch military, government and commercial sector. DCWC is the only networking community in the Netherlands centering on topics such as digital warfare, cybercrime and cyber defense.

Don is also a boardmember for the Connect2Trust Foundation, which is a critical Dutch trust network between companies to share threat intelligence and best practices.

treasury_media.title: Google Cloud Platform - Core Infrastructure
treasury_media.description: GCP Fundamentals course by Google on Coursera

treasury_media.title: US vs The World - The Cyber Monroe Doctrine
treasury_media.description: On December 2nd in 1823, the US introduced the Monroe Doctrine. This article declared that the US would view further European interference in the Americas (the Western Hemisphere) as acts of aggression and reserved the right to an armed response.

treasury_media.title: Cyber - Boundless Nonsense
treasury_media.description: In the Cyber industry, there is much to gripe about. We have a lot of very vocal experts out there, and roughly the same amount of opinions as there are experts. Most of the times, the differences of opinion are really just people being pedantic (or clueless) and while this is a detriment to the entire industry, we have bigger fish to fry.

treasury_media.title: The Chilling State of Cyber Affairs
treasury_media.description: With all the attention pointed towards PRISM, another interesting publication was virtually overlooked. Earlier last month, a taskforce belonging to the US DoD's Defense Science Board (DSB) released a final report titled "Resilient Military Systems and the Advanced Cyber Threat " [PDF], that reports on the findings of an 18-month research project.

treasury_media.title: PRISM: Tip of the Cyber Intel Iceberg
treasury_media.description: When Edward Snowden published information on PRISM - a rather drastic intelligence gathering program in which several (assume All) government agencies such as the FBI and the NSA draw intelligence from major tech companies such as Microsoft, Skype and Facebook - he was immediately revered and reviled by the general populace.

profile_positions.description:
Argent Consulting is a globally operating strategic management firm with a specialization in Cyber. We offer the highest level of consultancy in cyber security strategy and policy development, strong consistent security architecture and operational deployment thereof. Our services include training and board advisory services. Our clients range from governments and large global enterprises to mid-sized firms in all industries, including Production, Oil & Gas, IT, Technology, Telecommunications, Financial, Automotive and Maritime. 

Argent Consulting - Full Spectrum Cyber
profile_positions.title: CEO

profile_positions.description: I am a guest lecturer at Nyenrode as a part of the MBA module Business & Cyber Resillience.
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecturer

profile_positions.description: I was the interim CISO at the Erasmus University Rotterdam.
profile_positions.title: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) a.i.

profile_positions.description:
Security in a 100% cloud-only environment for a tech scale-up that is doing GREAT! It was both a challenge and a dream! 

I always enjoy learning. Lots and lots of experience gained in DevSecOps, Agile, ISO27001 certification and IaaS (in this case Google Cloud Platform and GSuite).
profile_positions.title: Head Of Information Security a.i.

profile_positions.description: Among my responsibilities were the drafting of a cyber security strategy, strategic plan, security roadmap to 2020 and the refreshing of the information security policy to 2016 standards (based on ISO27002:2013). Furthermore I was responsible for the initiation and management of sub-projects furthering the strategic objective of making cyber security a core business proficiency. Security evangelism and the drafting of a global and company-wide security awareness program were also a critical part of my tasks for Van Oord.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager Security a.i.

profile_positions.description: Same firm as previous, different role. Lead Cyber Security Architect / chief security advisor on a program that aims to address cyber security from the strategic level downward, global/enterprise-wide.
profile_positions.title: Lead Cyber Security Architect / Chief Security Advisor a.i.

profile_positions.description: Lead architect for a project that entails a major revamp of every aspect of the network, inspired by the Snowden revelations. This project is quite possibly the most challenging and leading-edge as it can possibly get in the realm of Cyber. Im honored to have coordinated the efforts of +/- 80 excellent technicians and architects.
profile_positions.title: Lead [Cyber Security] Architect a.i.

volunteer_experiences.role: Founder and Chairman of the Board
volunteer_experiences.description:
The Dutch Cyber Warfare Community group was created to bring together people from the Dutch armed forces, government agencies as well as the commercial sector; to create a platform for communication and to allow people in the business to network and share information as individuals and equals. 

The group does not have a commercial angle and membership is exclusive to those who actually have a link to Cyber Warfare. We frequently arrange networking events that are dubbed Roundtables, during which we invite high-quality speakers that lecture about the current state of affairs. It is truly a boon to anyone seeking to network with individuals who have the same passion about the subject of Cyber Warfare. 

If you are part of the Dutch Cyber Warfare Community (or have a strong desire to be), sign up for this group on LinkedIn!
Head of CSFI´s Educational programme in Europe.

NCDI (Dutch Cyber Doctrine Institute) is a think tank that brings together ICT Security experience and methods, and military doctrine to develop a usable mix for the emerging field of cyber warfare.

I am a boardmember of this foundation.
